This was another question asked of me at an interview.
While I did not sign a non disclosure agreement, I'm not going to mention which company I was interviewing with at the time.  

The problem:
Determine which 5 consecutive integers in the following number can be added up to create the largest possible sum.

number:


My thought process:

Assuming the last 4 digits cannot be the start of their own contiguous subsequence sum (as there need to be 5 digits and wrapping around seems silly),
one only needs to iterate through and note every subsequence 

For instance, given the number:
123456789

the combinations are
12345
23456
34567
45678
56789

the sums of all these combinations are stored in a list M and the max sum is returned
